title: Keir Starmer in poll nightmare as lead over Nigel Farage cut in half
description: Keir Starmer's lead over Nigel Farage as 'best prime minister' halves in three months
content:
Sir Keir Starmer's lead over Nigel Farage as "best prime minister" has halved in three months, new polling shows. The YouGov survey found that 35% of Britons say Sir Keir would be a better premier than the Reform UK leader. Meanwhile, 28% picked the Clacton MP over the current PM. It marks an eight-point drop in Sir Keir's lead since the question was last asked in May when it was 44% to 29%.

Mr Farage was backed by respondents over Tory leader Kemi Badenoch by 23% to 21% in their head-to-head. Meanwhile, Sir Keir was 10 points ahead of Mrs Badenoch 30% to 20% respectively. When given a choice between the Reform UK leader and Jeremy Corbyn, who is set to launch a new political party, Mr Farage had a narrow lead with 30% to 29%. Meanwhile, Sir Keir beat the veteran left-winger by 27% to 22%.

Mr Farage scored highest when respondents were asked who would make a good PM. The Brexiteer was backed by 24% of respondents, compared to 8% for Mrs Badenoch, 19% for Mr Corbyn and 11% for Deputy PM Angela Rayner. Just 9% said Sir Keir has been a good prime minister so far, with 55% saying he has been poor or terrible.

summary: Sir Keir Starmer's lead over Nigel Farage as "best prime minister" has halved in three months, according to a YouGov survey. The survey found that 35% of Britons believe Sir Keir would be a better premier than the Reform UK leader, while 28% chose the Clacton MP over the current Prime Minister. This is an eight-point drop from the previous poll in May, when it was 44% to 29%. Mr Farage was supported by respondents over Tory leader Kemi Badenoch by 23% to 21%. When asked about the future of Jeremy Corbyn, Mr Farage had a narrow lead with 30% and 27%. However, only 9% of respondents said that Sir Keer has been a good prime minister so far, with 55% saying he has been poor or terrible.
shortSummary: Sir Keir Starmer's lead over Nigel Farage as best prime minister halved to 35%, with 28% selecting him over current leader Jeremy Corbyn.

argos_summary: Recent polling by YouGov indicates that Sir Keir Starmer's lead over Nigel Farage as the preferred prime minister has decreased from 44% to 35% in three months. Farage is now favored by 28% of respondents, while Starmer maintains a lead over Kemi Badenoch. Additionally, when compared to Jeremy Corbyn, Farage holds a slight edge, but Starmer outperforms Corbyn in their matchup.
